result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:00 AM Defendant Joshua Dominique Gillespie in court by audio with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense stipulates to Defendants identity. Court takes Judicial Notice of 14CF2383. Officer Mar Garcia sworn in and testitifed by video. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

records.addlTxt: Shanna Knueppel

03:13 PM Defendant Joshua Dominique Gillespie in court, in custody at the Rock County Jail by video  with attorney Francis P Raff by video.  David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address and date of birth confirmed. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature Bond of $1000 set with conditions: No contact with Co Defendant Tyler Young. Must remain in residence from 6pm-6am unless at work or traveling to and from work.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of weapons.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
